etymologies: Old English; earliest use found in Lacnunga. From hot + water

definitions: Water at a high temperature, either naturally as in a hot spring, or artificially heated for cookery, washing, or other purposes; (in later use) specifically heated water available on tap (in a home, hotel, etc.).
A state of discomfort, difficulty, or painful uncertainty; disgrace, trouble. Chiefly in "in hot water".
In plural. Alcoholic spirits obtained by distillation; spirituous liquors.
